meanings.meaning: 1. what 今のアナウンスは何だったのですか。What did the announcement just say?
2. you-know-what; that thing
3. whatsit; whachamacallit; what's-his-name; what's-her-name

4. penis; (one's) thing; dick Colloquial, Usually written using kana alone, esp. ナニ「や、それほどでも。せいぜい、大きさ比べたり、わい談するくらいだし」「大きさって何の？」「ナニの」"No, not so much. At most comparing sizes, telling dirty stories." "Sizes of what?" "Of 'that'."
8. oh, no (it's fine); why (it's nothing); oh (certainly not) used to dismiss someone's worries, concerns, etc.
ナニ
1. what See also 何彼は今何の仕事をしているのですか。What is he up to now?
2. how many See also 何か月, followed by a counterここの家、何匹猫がいるの？How many cats are there in this house?
3. many; a lot of See also 何度も, See also 何日も, followed by (optional number), counter and も私は何軒もの店でその本を探しました。I inquired about the book in many stores.
4. several; a few; some See also 何日か, followed by a counter and か学校の前に何本か木が見えます。You see some trees in front of the school.
1. what 今のアナウンスは何だったのですか。What did the announcement just say?
2. you-know-what; that thing
3. whatsit; whachamacallit; what's-his-name; what's-her-name

4. penis; (one's) thing; dick Colloquial, Usually written using kana alone, esp. ナニ「や、それほどでも。せいぜい、大きさ比べたり、わい談するくらいだし」「大きさって何の？」「ナニの」"No, not so much. At most comparing sizes, telling dirty stories." "Sizes of what?" "Of 'that'."
8. oh, no (it's fine); why (it's nothing); oh (certainly not) used to dismiss someone's worries, concerns, etc.
ナニ

sentences.translation: What did the announcement just say?
"No, not so much. At most comparing sizes, telling dirty stories." "Sizes of what?" "Of 'that'."
What? You can't do it? You coward! Chicken!

meanings.meaning: 1. which; what (way) Usually written using kana alone, See also この, See also その, See also あの
何の: Rarely-used kanji form.

何の: Rarely-used kanji form.
1. always; all the time; at all times Usually written using kana alone彼はいつも学校に遅れる。He is always late for school.
2. never Usually written using kana alone, with neg. verb私は日曜日にはいつも家にいない。I'm never at home on Sundays.

meanings.type: Noun which may take the genitive case particle 'no', Noun
meanings.meaning: 3. usual; regular; habitual; customary Usually written using kana aloneいつものところでいつもの人達に会った。I met the usual people at the usual place.

meanings.meaning: 1. (not) anything; (nothing) at all; (not) any; nothing with neg. verb過ちのない者は何も作り出せない。He who makes no mistakes makes nothing.
2. and everything else; and all as ...も何も車も何もなく、生活保護で生きてます。I'm living on welfare, without a car or anything.
3. (not) at all; (not) in the least; (not) especially; (not) to that extent as ...なくてもいい, ...ことはない, etc.
1. (not) anything; (nothing) at all; (not) any; nothing with neg. verb過ちのない者は何も作り出せない。He who makes no mistakes makes nothing.
2. and everything else; and all as ...も何も車も何もなく、生活保護で生きてます。I'm living on welfare, without a car or anything.
3. (not) at all; (not) in the least; (not) especially; (not) to that extent as ...なくてもいい, ...ことはない, etc.

sentences.translation: He who makes no mistakes makes nothing.
I'm living on welfare, without a car or anything.

meanings.meaning: 1. why?; what for? Usually written using kana aloneテニスウェアってなんでミニスカートなのかしら？I wonder why tennis is played in mini-skirts.
2. how?; by what means? ここになんで来たの？How did you come here?

1. what; how 英語でこの昆虫を何といいますか。What do you call this insect in English?

meanings.meaning: 1. above anything else; above all; more than anything 何より大事なことは、自分の頭で考えることだ。The most important thing is thinking for oneself.

meanings.type: Expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.), Noun which may take the genitive case particle 'no', Noun
meanings.meaning: 2. best; greatest; excellent; wonderful; most important 私は自分が健康で何よりだと思っている。I count myself lucky in having good health.

meanings.type: Expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.), Noun which may take the genitive case particle 'no', Noun

meanings.meaning: 1. (a) little; somewhat; somehow Usually written using kana alone
1. Aga
1. Itsuka
1. how; in what way; by what means Usually written using kana alone, See also どうやってそのニュースはどうして漏れたのだろう。How did the news get out?
2. why; for what reason; for what purpose; what for Usually written using kana aloneどうしてあなたにお詫びする理由があるのですか。Why should I apologize to you?
4. no way Usually written using kana alone, often as どうして、どうして
如何して: Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: How did the news get out?
Why should I apologize to you?

meanings.meaning: 1. by all means; at any cost; no matter what; at any rate; surely Usually written using kana alone彼女はどうしても自分の思い通りにしようとする。She will have her own way.
2. whether (one is) willing or not; willingly or unwillingly; willy-nilly Usually written using kana alone
3. on no account; by no means Usually written using kana alone, with. neg. verb残念ですが、あなたの名前をどうしても覚えられない。I'm sorry to say I don't remember your name.
4. in the end; in the long run; after all; eventually Usually written using kana aloneその計画を成功させるためには君の援助がどうしても必要だ。Your help is indispensable for the success of the scheme.
如何しても: Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: She will have her own way.
I'm sorry to say I don't remember your name.
Your help is indispensable for the success of the scheme.
